description: This file is a unit test for the TriState class, which appears to represent a tri-state logic (True, False, Unknown). It sets up various TriState objects, invokes methods like Get() and Set(), and uses Google Test macros to verify the behavior.

classes.name: TriState
classes.description: A class representing a tri-state logic with states True, False, and Unknown. It provides methods for retrieving and setting its state.

methods.name: TriState(const char*)
methods.description: Constructor that initializes the TriState object from a string representation.

methods.name: TriState(TriState::EnumState)
methods.description: Constructor that initializes the state directly with an EnumState value.

methods.name: Get()
methods.description: Returns the current state as an EnumState.

methods.name: Set(bool)
methods.description: Sets the state based on a boolean value.

methods.name: Set(TriState::EnumState)
methods.description: Sets the state explicitly to a given EnumState.
